item.title: A weekend with Nicholas Felton
item.description: Last weekend we had a workshop with Nicholas Felton. I guess he is mainly known for his annual report where he visualises personal data that he gathered manually or using his selfmade app, that can be found on his website. He gave a nice introduction to the basics of processing. For the assignment we gathered a dataset out of some magazines he brought. Pictures in relation to text, how many people on picture, how many lines of text and so on.

item.title: Taste of Berlin
item.description: I made the shape of Berlin out of mashed potatoes as the most people living in Berlin are still germans and potatoes are very german to me. I flavoured Spandau with Vodka and pickled cucumbers, guess who lives here :) For Poland I took instant borschtsch and sauerkraut, coconutmilk and lemongrass for Vietnamese, humus and dried dates for arabian and garlic and feta cheese for the turkish people. I asked the other participants of my course to try it and guess which taste refers to what country.

item.title: First Week
item.description: Wow, the first week is over, its Saturday and I will have to get ready for the Weekend course held by Nicholas Feltron soon. But I quickly want to recap the last week. Stefanie Posavec stayed the first four days with us. On Monday we got an introduction and after lunch we all went out in to the city to gather our own data set. I first thought I’d go to a cafe to get data like how many groups, how many people on their own, how many people “communicating” via devices as human communication, or the lack of real world human communication is something pretty present in my head these days.

item.title: Back to School!
item.description: Looks like I’m going back to school, the School of Machines, Make and Make-Believe to attend a course about Data Visualisation. It will start on Monday, 2nd of November and will be a 4 week, full time course. I hope to have time writing about it here. And I hope it will get a little more colourful here :)
